predicted: 4) A polymath.  A polymath is a person who has a wide range of knowledge or expertise in many different areas. The term is often used to describe someone who is well-read, well-educated, and has a broad range of interests. In this sense, a polymath is someone who can easily understand or relate to many different things, making them a good match for the Chinese idiom 触类旁通.  The other options, while related to knowledge or expertise, do not quite capture the breadth of understanding implied by 触类旁通.  For example, a Jack of all trades may be knowledgeable in many areas, but may not necessarily be able to understand or relate to them in a deep or meaningful way.  A man of many talents may be skilled in many areas, but may not necessarily have a broad range of knowledge or understanding.  A Renaissance man may have a broad range of interests and knowledge, but may not necessarily be able to understand or relate to many different things in a practical or applied way.
